intro: Luzula sudetica var. pauciflora, commonly known as the alpine wood rush, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses and related plants. This variety is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences that produce numerous tiny flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. The plant is adapted to harsh conditions, showcasing its resilience in high-altitude ecosystems.
